turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I'll be damned.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Do I know you?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Mind if we sit down?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: I'd prefer you didn't.  I'm very busy.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Okay, then how 'bout we ask you a few questions?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Detective...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Carter.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: ... I think it would be best if you both left.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Might want to stop and think about the safety of your students, Miss Tate.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: I never stop thinking about it, Detective.  The only way in or out of this school is through that gate, and it is secured at all times.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Funny, we just drove right in.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Well, I can assure you, it won't happen again.  Thanks for your concern.  Goodbye.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Bruce... what's going on?  The kids are here to pick out their costumes for the festival.

turns.speaker: DEPUTY CLARK
turns.text: Better take 'em to Virgil's downtown.  We got a dead body in there.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: A dead body?

turns.speaker: DEPUTY CLARK
turns.text: It's Amy Kramer.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: My god...

turns.speaker: DEPUTY CLARK
turns.text: Pretty messy.  Parents have already been notified.  Our office has been trying to get a hold of you...

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Do you know who did this?

turns.speaker: DEPUTY CLARK
turns.text: Well, Eddie Catero didn't show up for work this morning... parents say he never came home last night. Car's still missing.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Think Eddie had something to do with it?

turns.speaker: DEPUTY CLARK
turns.text: Doesn't look good.

turns.speaker: SHANE
turns.text: Besides, it's historically inaccurate.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

turns.speaker: SHANE
turns.text: Michael Meyers never used a meat cleaver.  It was a butcher knife.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Who are you, the serial killer police?  What difference does it make?

turns.speaker: SHANE
turns.text: It's not historically accurate, that's all.

turns.speaker: SHANE
turns.text: Another historical inaccuracy.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Would somebody shut this guy up?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Hey, Mis Whittington, what's up?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: My blood pleasure.  You scared the hell out of me.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Oh.  Sorry.  I'm on my way to the ring and --

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: I think someone broke into my house.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: No shit?!

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: No shit.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Jimmy, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Checking out your place.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: No.  Wait for the police.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: And miss the big game?  No way.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Nothing to fear.  The coast is clear.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Totally.  I checked all the rooms and closets...

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Nothing's missing?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Don't think so.  But they sure did a real number on your office. Crap everywhere.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: My office?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yeah.  Oh, and they messed up your kitchen pretty good, too... Goodnight.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Nothing's changed since yesterday, or last week, or last month... the answer's still "no."

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You're so predictable.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What the --

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Betcha' didn't predict that.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm sixteen, Keri.  I should be able to live wherever I want.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: And I should have a son who calls me "Mom".  Looks like we're both shit out of luck.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Okay, you win.  I'll call you Mom. Now can I move into the dorms?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Well, Dad thinks it's okay.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: You're father thinks it's okay to run off to Cancun with a blonde bimbo in a halter top.  Somehow his opinion doesn't count.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I promise not to run off to Cancun.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: The dorms are only fifty feet away.  You could practically see into my window.  So, what difference does it make?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: My point exactly.  See, we both agree.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Alright, I was wrong.  There is a big difference between rooming with your buddies and living with your mother and school headmaster.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: I took the padlock off your door. What more do you want?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: My life is a living hell.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: To the bathroom.  Can I do that alone or do you want to watch?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: I thought you'd never ask.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You're twisted.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Shit, John!  What the hell were you doing out there?!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: You're kidding with that answer, right?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I just went for a walk.  It's no big deal.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Wrong.  There are rules in this house and you're going to follow them whether you like it or not.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Or what?  You're gonna shoot me?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: It's an option.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Well, maybe if you'd let me live in the dorms, I wouldn't have to sneak out to spend time with my friends.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Oh, so now it's my fault?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Just forget it...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm sorry, alright?  It was just a stupid joke.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Will, sit down...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You some kind of fugitive or something?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: I was trying to get away from someone.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Now you're joking, right?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Afraid not.  You can pick your friends, but you can't pick your family.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Wait a minute... slow down... you're telling me Michael Meyers is my uncle?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Any other psychotic relatives I should know about?  Jason?  Freddy Krueger?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: I was trying to protect you from this...

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: He found you, didn't he?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Get on the bus.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Where's Molly?  She's not in her room...

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Just get on the bus.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm not leaving without her.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: John, you can't help her now.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What?  Where is she?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: John...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh, God... no... not Molly.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Please, get on the bus...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah, me too, Keri.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Call me Laurie, will ya?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Keri.... Laurie... how about if I just call you Mom?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: That would work.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Shelve the barf bag.  It's the key to the main gate.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Where'd you get it?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Swiped it from my mom's desk yesterday.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: You stole it?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I borrowed it.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Not me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: I can't afford to get caught.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Nah, I didn't tell her where I went.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Is that all you guys can think about?  Amy never came back last night.  Maybe she's in trouble.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: What are you doing here?!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I came to see you.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: I can see that.  Why?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Can I come in?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Are you crazy?  You'll get caught.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Then you come out here.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Then I'll get caught.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Well, I'm not going until I talk to you.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Alright.  I'll come out.  Just be quiet.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: You really think Eddie killed her?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You saw that Michael Meyers display.  You've got to be pretty twisted to come up with something like that.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: I guess.  It's just hard to believe.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You look kind of cold.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: I'm okay.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Here, take my jacket.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Better?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Molly, of all the people... if I can't trust my resident assistant, then what?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: I know.  I'm really, really sorry, Miss Tate.  Please let me keep the job... it's the only way I can afford to stay here.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Okay, tell you what... you can still be the school R.A., but no dance tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Okay... thank you.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Linda!  He killed Linda!

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Who?!

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Michael Meyers!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Aren't they doing a terrific job this year?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Looks great.  It does.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You okay?  You seem a little off.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Nothing a good stiff drink can't fix.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: It's John, isn't it?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: It's always John.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Still wants to move out?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: He's been living out of moving boxes for three months.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: This kid just wants his freedom.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: It's not going to happen.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: The tighter you squeeze, the harder he'll try to break free.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Oh, please... you get that out of a fortune cookie?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Doesn't make it bad advice.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: I'm going into town... run a few errands before dark.  Need anything?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: A box of fortune cookies... I'm running out of advice.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Bye Will.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Hey, you alright?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What are you looking at?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: I'm fine.  I just need to lie down...

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: There's something I have to tell you both.  It's going to sound strange...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: My name hasn't always been Keri Tate.  It was once Laurie Strode.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You're right.  It does sound strange.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Michael Meyers.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: The serial killer?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: He's my brother.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: No, Will, this isn't the alcohol talking.  It's the truth.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I can't believe this is happening.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Shit happens.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You just dropped a shitload on him... give him some time to digest it.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Are you going to leave, too?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Never.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: So you're really Michael Meyers' sister?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Do we have to invite him to the wedding?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: Not a real fan of Halloween humor, Will.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Oh, right.  Sorry.

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: I'm gonna head back to the office... finish up some things.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Can't it wait till Monday?  I thought maybe we could dance...  I'm very light of my feet.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Keri, you all right?

turns.speaker: KERI
turns.text: We've got to get these kids out of here...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I'll make sure there's no kids left in the dorms...

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Look, they're staring right at us.

turns.speaker: SHANE
turns.text: You think your mom knows we snuck out last night?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Wait.

turns.speaker: SHANE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I have to pee.

turns.speaker: SHANE
turns.text: Can't you hold it?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Can't you?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: You aced it, didn't you?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: I did alright.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Fuckin' A.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: He gave me a fuckin' A?  Wow.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: You say, "The key to my heart," and I'm gonna hurl.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Better her than me.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: You're unbelievable.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Ooooh, busted.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Big time.  And news travels fast. Wouldn't be surprised if the whole school knows about this one by tonight.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Shane's going as a condom.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: I thought you were allergic to latex.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I'll pop a Benadryl.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: You think they'll let him in dressed like that?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Oh, they're so stupid... I'll just tell them he's going as a sausage casing.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: BLAAAAAGGGHHHHH!

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Shit, Linda!

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: You're so easy...

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Wasn't scaring the hell out of me once today enough?!

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Nope.  Hey, you think I'll win scariest costume?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Linda, you are without a doubt the scariest person on campus.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Thanks!

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Where's Shane?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Condom Boy is waiting for me in the cafeteria.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: But the dance is in the gymnasium.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Very insightful.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Let the party begin.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Have enough fun for the both of us.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Oh, don't be such a victim.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: He do that to you?

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Another episode of 'Daddy Knows Best' at the Strode house.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Pig.  What the hell happened this time?

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Beth, who's that guy that lives across the hall from you?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Why?  You interested?

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: No!  I keep seeing him staring out his window. Watching me.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You mean Tommy.  Yeah, on the weirdness scale he's about an eleven.  Supposedly some scary shit happened to him when he was a kid.  Messed up his head.  He's harmless, though.  Probably just lonely.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Mom -- Who is this?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Kara? ... No, this is Beth.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: What are you doing there?  Where's my mother?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: We were worried about you guys so we left early to see if you were --

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Is Tim there?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: He's in the bathroom.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Hold on, hot lips.  We got work to do.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Shit, Beth, why do we have to be the ones to organnize this friggin' fair? It's only Halloween.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Whatever happened to women in back?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Reality check, dillweed.  This is 1995.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Happy fuckin' Halloween.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Someone's trying to scare us out of having this fair ... and it's not gonna work.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Seven-thirty is the costume pageant ... Carving jack-o'-lanterns at eight ... Photos for the school paper at nine ... Then Harry lights the tree at nine- thirty ... I just know I'm forgetting something!

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Relax.  Everything's cool.  Didn't I tell you Harry would be here?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Jesus, that's my neighbor.  Tommy.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Isn't he that psycho who's been spying on my sister?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Kara and Danny never showed up tonight. We'd better go home and check on them. There's nothing else for us to do here.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: But they're gonna light the tree in a few minutes --

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: We can light our own tree at home.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Guess they -- went to the fair after all.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Guess so ...

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What if your parents come home?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Then they can watch.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Aren't you gonna answer that?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Answer what?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What if it's Kara?

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Shh.  Mommy's here.  What is it?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The voice man!  He's here!

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Home is here in Grandma and Grandpa's new house.  At least while I'm in college. Remember our deal.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: The kids at school said this is a haunted house -- that a bad man used to live here.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: They did, did they?  Since when did we start listening to the kids at school?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: But I've seen him!

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: You've been watching too much TV.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: He says things.  Bad things.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No, Mom -- keep it on!

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Okay ... But just for tonight.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Mom, I want to go to the fair ...

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: You can't expect us to stay here --

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Come on, Mom.  We're gonna miss all the fun stuff!

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Danny, you're just going to have to wait!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Mommy, I'm scared.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: There's nothing to be scared of, baby. It's just another storm.  Try to get some sleep.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I can't.  The voice man is coming to get me.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: No one's coming to get you.  Not while I'm around.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Promise?

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: I promise.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Mommy!!!

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Danny!!!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Shitheads ... Defacing my property.  I showed them ...

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: Relax, John.  They were just kids.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Kids are what's ruining this country. Everywhere you go, it's the same.  No goddamn respect.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: See what I'm talkin' about?

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: You'll never pass that exam on an empty stomach, Kara.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What is it this time?

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: A man came by the house.  A psychiatrist by the name of Loomis.

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: He told me about the terrible things that happened here.  In our house.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What the fuck are you doing letting strangers in without --

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: John, they sound Jamie Lloyd this morning! Someone tried to kill her!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What in God's name are you talking about, woman?  When are you gonna stop listening to those damned talk shows?

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: I'm getting the children out of here. At least until we know what we're dealing with.  John, I want you to come with us.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Debra, you're fuckin' insane.

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: You knew, didn't you, John?  You knew.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: I've been knocking.  The door was open. Is everything all right in here?

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: I've come to help your family.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: He crept up these stairs and made his way into this room.  His sister's room. Right here. Where it all began.

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: What makes you think he'll come here again?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: This house is sacred to him.  It's the source of his memories -- his rage.  Mrs. Strode, I beg you.  Don't let your family suffer the same fast as Laurie and her daughter.

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: Jamie?  But I thought she was --

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Found this morning.  In a field outside Haddonfield.  Stabbed.

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: What should I do?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Lock the doors and call your husband. Get your family as far away from Haddonfield as possible.

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: God ... this can't be true.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Mrs. Strode, Michael Myers is here to kill his family.  And he won't stop until you are all destroyed.  I only thank God that I found you before he did.

turns.speaker: HARRY SIMMS
turns.text: So they're trying to kill you and your baby. Don't tell me.  Your name also happens to be Rosemary.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: No -- please listen!  They're coming ... coming for me and my baby.

turns.speaker: HARRY SIMMS
turns.text: Come on, sweetheart -- what is this? Who's coming?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: It's ... Michael ...  ... Michael Myers!

turns.speaker: HARRY SIMMS
turns.text: So they're trying to kill you and your baby. Don't tell me.  Your name also happens to be Rosemary.

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: No, please listen!  They're coming ... coming for me and my baby.

turns.speaker: HARRY SIMMS
turns.text: Come on, sweetheart -- what is this? Who's coming?

turns.speaker: JAMIE
turns.text: It's ... Michael ... Michael Myers!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: She wasn't here when I brought Danny home from --

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Danny, go downstairs -- Now!

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: My, God!  What have you done to him?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: I didn't -- He got in a fight and I --

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: You stay away from him!

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Do you know how insane this is?  Who am I supposed to be looking for?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Him.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: God, what's wrong with him?

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Here.  Let me try.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Kyle's mother might be dead for all I know. Now I'm afraid he could be next.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Why would anyone want to kill an innocent baby?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Not just Kyle.  All of you.  His entire family.  Here.  Look at this.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: It was there when I found him this morning.  It looks like some kind of letter or number or --

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: It's a rune ... Thorn.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Runes were a kind of early alphabet that originated in Northern Europe thousands of years ago.  They were symbols -- carved out of stone or pieces of wood.  Of all the runes, Thorn had the most negative influence. Cults used them in blood rituals to portend future events and invoke magic.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Black magic ...  'In ancient times, Thorn was believed to cause sickness, famine and death. Translated literally, it was the name of a demon spirit that delivered human sacrifices ... on the Celtic celebration of Samhain.'

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Halloween.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: 'When applied directly to another person, Thorn could be used to call upon them confusion and destruction -- to literally visit them with the Devil.'

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: To find the rest of your family before Michael Myers does -- or whoever's been controlling him.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Danny?!  Danny!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Mrs. Blankenship, have you seen the little boy who came in with me and --

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Where's the baby?!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: He's gone.

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Danny!  Danny, where are you?!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Kara, no!

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: What now?!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Wait a minute ...

turns.speaker: KARA
turns.text: Come on!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: It's not working!

turns.speaker: WYNN
turns.text: Christ, what a night!  Not even so much as a sign for five miles on that road!

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: That's the whole idea of living in the country.  I thrive on the seclusion.

turns.speaker: WYNN
turns.text: Unlike you, Sam, I learned many years ago not to second-guess the motives of my fellow man. Remember what Freud said:  'Sometimes a cigar is just a cigar.'  Or, in this case, a drink is just a drink.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: I hope you didn't come all the way out here in this storm just to quote Freud.

turns.speaker: WYNN
turns.text: As always, your keen powers of perception astound me.  And you're right.  I've come to celebrate.  After thirty-two years as Psychiatric Administrator, guess who has been named Smith's Groves new Chief of Staff.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: But surely Rogers isn't --

turns.speaker: WYNN
turns.text: Retiring.

turns.speaker: WYNN
turns.text: We need you, Dr. Loomis.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: You should know that it's not wise to play Halloween pranks on me.

turns.speaker: WYNN
turns.text: You're the only man for the job, Sam. Things haven't been the same since you left.  I'm recruiting the best psychiatric team in the country.  Old colleagues.  This is your change to finally make a difference.
